source.name: SFMTA - DPT Speed Limits by Street Segment (Zipped Shapefile Format)
source.description:
Record speed limits for enforcement and monitoring purposes. Updated as speed limits are modified over time.
Speed limits are indicated primarily for streets that have speeds higher than 25 MPH. 25 MPH is the de facto speed limit for residential and most commercial streets. Alleys narrower than 25 feet can have de facto speed limits of 15 MPH. 

SpeedLimit column: The “0” value is for all the streets that are legislated for 25miles per hour and less. 

It also includes 15miles per hour streets. In other words the 25miles and lower per hour is the defacto. 

The count are the number of line segments drawn which are also the number of blocks on each streets. The line segments are drawn from the start of a block to the end of the block. This is necessary because the same street can have 2 different speed limits.

The “99” Value was entered for any and all other speed limits over 45MPH. They are mostly high ways and freeways within the City.
